turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about St. Mary of Czestochowa Parish (Middletown, Connecticut).
turn.1: Is there any historical information on St. Mary of Czestochowa Parish?
turn.2: It was listed in an inventory of buildings of Middletown by the Greater Middletown Preservation Trust in 1979.
turn.3: What kind of architectural style was used for the building of St. Mary's?
turn.4: Architecturally, the school is a brick, two-story, Renaissance Revival building with some Art Deco details.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Kathleen Dutil served as the principal for years until her retirement in 2012.
turn.7: Who was the principal after Kathleen Dutil retired?
turn.8: Kathleen Peck resumed her role and stayed principal until 2016. Peck currently serves the school in a vice principal capacity.
turn.9: Who else worked at St. Mary's?
turn.10: Other notable former teachers include Sister Catherine Mary Symanski, Tamara Coburn, and longtime secretary Linda Mikulski.
turn.11: Were there any other organizations that were formed to support the school?
turn.12: The parish has a local Knights of Columbus chapter, denoted Pope John Paul II Council #14017
